text.78: Pada ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa Dia akan menyelesaikan semua persoalan yang diperselisihkan Bani Israil dengan keputusan-Nya yang adil lagi bijaksana. Dengan demikian, yang batil akan mendapat azab, dan yang benar akan diberi pahala sesuai dengan amalnya, karena Allah adalah Tuhan Yang Mahaperkasa lagi Maha Mengetahui.
text.79: Pada ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa Dia akan menyelesaikan semua persoalan yang diperselisihkan Bani Israil dengan keputusan-Nya yang adil lagi bijaksana. Dengan demikian, yang batil akan mendapat azab, dan yang benar akan diberi pahala sesuai dengan amalnya, karena Allah adalah Tuhan Yang Mahaperkasa lagi Maha Mengetahui.
text.80:
Pada ayat ini, Allah menjelaskan bahwa Nabi Muhammad tidak ditugaskan supaya menjadikan orang-orang musyrik itu beriman. Beliau hanya ditugaskan untuk menyampaikan seruan atau risalah dari Allah. Tidak termasuk wewenang beliau untuk memaksa orang kafir menjadi seorang mukmin. Hal tersebut berada dalam kekuasaan Allah. Nabi tidak mampu memasukkan petunjuk ke dalam hati orang yang sudah terkunci mati. Ayat ini juga menjelaskan bahwa Muhammad tidak dapat menjadikan orang-orang yang mati itu mendengar dan tidak pula menjadikan orang-orang tuli mendengar panggilan, terlebih lagi bila hati mereka telah berpaling ke belakang.

Kalimat "orang-orang yang mati" dan "orang-orang yang tuli" dalam ayat ini adalah ungkapan metafora. Maksudnya adalah orang-orang musyrik itu dianggap sebagai orang yang sudah mati pikirannya, sudah tuli dan tidak dapat mendengar panggilan dan ajakan kebaikan. Mereka telah berpaling ke belakang. Mereka diserupakan dengan orang yang mati dan orang yang tuli karena semua ayat yang dibacakan kepada mereka tidak berpengaruh sama sekali

Walaupun secara umum ayat ini menjelaskan bahwa orang yang telah mati tidak dapat mendengar seruan orang yang masih hidup, tetapi ada beberapa hadis yang sahih, seperti yang diriwayatkan oleh Muslim, yang menerangkan bahwa Nabi Muhammad pernah berbicara pada mayat-mayat kaum musyrikin yang terbunuh waktu perang Badar dan dikubur bersama-sama dalam sebuah sumur. Melihat hal itu, sebagian sahabat, di antaranya Umar bin Khattab, menyatakan keheranannya dengan bertanya mengapa Rasulullah berbicara dengan orang yang sudah meninggal. Menanggapi hal itu, Rasulullah bersabda: 

Kamu tidak lebih mendengar daripada mereka terhadap apa yang aku katakan, hanya saja mereka tidak dapat menjawab. (Riwayat Imam Muslim dari Anas bin Malik)

Pengertian yang terkandung dalam hadis di atas adalah bahwa orang-orang yang masih hidup dan mayat-mayat itu sama dapat mendengar ucapan Nabi. Akan tetapi, orang yang masih hidup dapat menjawab, sedangkan mereka tidak. Dalam beberapa hadis yang sahih diterangkan pula oleh Nabi bahwa bila seorang mayat telah selesai dimasukkan ke kuburnya, ia dapat mendengar suara sepatu atau terompah orang-orang yang mengantarnya. 

Sebagai seorang penyampai risalah Allah, Nabi tidak dapat memberi hidayah kepada orang-orang musyrik untuk menjadi mukmin sebagaimana yang terjadi dengan paman Nabi yaitu Abu thalib yang hingga akhir hidupnya tidak beriman. Firman Allah:

Sungguh, engkau (Muhammad) tidak dapat memberi petunjuk kepada orang yang engkau kasihi, tetapi Allah memberi petunjuk kepada orang yang Dia kehendaki, dan Dia lebih mengetahui orang-orang yang mau menerima petunjuk (al-Qasas/28: 56)

Tugas Nabi hanya memberi petunjuk dalam arti memberi bimbingan (irsyad), memberi keterangan (bayan), dan melaksanakannya, sebagaimana firman Allah:

... Dan sungguh, engkau benar-benar membimbing (manusia) kepada jalan yang lurus.(asy-Syura/42: 52) 

Pengertian hidayah pada Surah al-Qasas/28: 56 di atas adalah "taufik". Hal ini mengandung pengertian bahwa Nabi tidak mempunyai kewenangan untuk memberi taufik kepada manusia, walaupun terhadap orang yang dicintainya, misalnya Abu thalib. hanya Allah yang dapat memberi hidayah dalam arti taufik kepada orang-orang yang dikehendaki-Nya. 

Adapun hidayah pada Surah as-Syura/42: 52 bermakna "tabyin dan irsyad". Hal ini berarti bahwa Nabi mempunyai kewenangan untuk memberi penjelasan dengan petunjuk yang luas.
text.81: Pada ayat ini, Allah memperkuat pengertian ayat sebelumnya bahwa Nabi Muhammad sama sekali tidak dapat memalingkan orang-orang buta yang telah terkunci hatinya dari kesesatan. Mata hatinya tidak dapat diberi petunjuk kepada jalan yang lurus karena ada hijab atau dinding yang menutupi pandangannya, sehingga tidak dapat melihat kebenaran sama sekali. Nabi Muhammad tidak dapat menjadikan seseorang dapat mendengar seruannya dengan pendengaran yang positif, kecuali orang-orang yang beriman kepada Allah, lalu berserah diri secara tulus ikhlas kepada-Nya.
text.82:
Pada ayat ini, Allah menjelaskan bila kemarahan dan kemurkaan-Nya telah dijatuhkan kepada manusia yang durhaka, karena meninggalkan perintah dan mengotori kemurnian agama-Nya, maka pada saat menjelang datangnya hari Kiamat, binatang-binatang melata keluar dari bumi dan berbicara kepada mereka dengan lidah yang fasih, bahwa kebanyakan manusia tidak yakin kepada ayat-ayat Allah, dan tidak percaya akan datangnya hari Kiamat. Ucapan dari binatang melata itu mengandung cercaan dan peringatan yang sangat keras kepada manusia yang berada di sekelilingnya. Keanehan yang akan terjadi sebelum kiamat, di mana seekor binatang melata dapat berbicara memberi peringatan kepada orang-orang yang durhaka, tidak mustahil bagi Allah. Ia dapat memberi kemampuan kepada binatang tersebut untuk berbicara pada saat itu, sesuai dengan firman-Nya:

Mereka berkata, "Allah yang telah menjadikan kami dapat bicara pasti juga dapat menjadikan segala sesuatu dapat berbicara." (Fussilat/41: 21)

Mengenai keluarnya binatang melata dianggap sebagai masalah gaib karena bentuk dan sifatnya tidak disebutkan dalam Al-Qur'an. Keterangan mengenai hal ini hanya terdapat dalam hadis. Di antaranya adalah hadis yang diriwayatkan oleh Muslim dari 'Abdullah bin amr:

'Abdullah bin 'Amr berkata, "Aku menghafal sebuah hadis dari Rasulullah saw yang tidak akan aku lupakan. Aku mendengar beliau bersabda, 'Tanda-tanda akan (datangnya kiamat) yang pertama kali muncul adalah terbitnya matahari dari sebelah barat dan keluarnya binatang melata kepada manusia di pagi hari. Manakala salah satu dari dua peristiwa ini terjadi, maka yang satu lagi segera menyusul setelahnya." (Riwayat Muslim)
text.83:
Pada ayat-ayat ini, Allah menerangkan tingkah laku dan perbuatan orang-orang kafir yang mengingkari Allah dan Rasul-Nya ketika mereka menyaksikan sendiri datangnya hari Kiamat. Pada hari itu, Allah mengumpulkan orang-orang yang mengingkari ayat-ayat-Nya dari setiap umat manusia. Setelah mereka berkumpul di Padang Mahsyar untuk dihisab, mereka semuanya berdiri di hadapan Allah untuk menghadapi berbagai pertanyaan dan pemeriksaan.

Orang-orang kafir dan musyrik mendengar dakwaan yang sangat menusuk perasaan. Di antaranya adalah mengapa mereka telah mengingkari ayat-ayat Allah yang secara jelas memberitahukan akan adanya hari kebangkitan dan hari penghisaban ini. Mengapa mereka tidak memikirkan persoalan itu, padahal dalil-dalilnya jelas dan gamblang disampaikan oleh rasul-rasul kepada mereka? Mengapa mereka bersikap sombong dan angkuh tidak mau menerima keterangan para rasul itu, padahal mereka tidak memiliki pengetahuan yang pasti dan tidak pernah memikirkannya secara teliti dan sungguh-sungguh.

Setelah mereka berkumpul di Padang Mahsyar untuk dihisab, mereka semuanya berdiri di hadapan Allah untuk menghadapi berbagai pertanyaan dan pemeriksaan.

Di antaranya adalah mengapa mereka telah mengingkari ayat-ayat Allah yang secara jelas memberitahukan akan adanya hari kebangkitan dan hari penghisaban ini. Mengapa mereka tidak memikirkan persoalan itu, padahal dalil-dalilnya jelas dan gamblang disampaikan oleh rasul-rasul kepada mereka? Mengapa mereka bersikap sombong dan angkuh tidak mau menerima keterangan para rasul itu, padahal mereka tidak memiliki pengetahuan yang pasti dan tidak pernah memikirkannya secara teliti dan sungguh-sungguh.
text.85:
Ayat ini menjelaskan bahwa kemurkaan Allah kepada orang-orang yang ingkar itu disebabkan kezaliman mereka sendiri. Mereka tidak dapat berkata apa-apa untuk menolak azab yang akan menimpa mereka seperti tersebut dalam firman Allah:

Inilah hari, saat mereka tidak dapat berbicara, dan tidak diizinkan kepada mereka mengemukakan alasan agar mereka dimaafkan. (al-Mursalat/77: 35-36)
text.86:
Setelah menyampaikan berita yang sangat menakutkan tentang kedahsyatan hari Kiamat, maka Allah pada ayat ini mengemukakan dalil-dalil keesaan-Nya, tentang kepastian akan datangnya hari kebangkitan, dan dalil-dalil yang membenarkan Muhammad saw sebagai utusan Allah. Di antara tanda-tanda kekuasaan Allah adalah adanya malam dan siang yang datang silih berganti. Apakah orang-orang yang mengingkari hari Kiamat itu tidak memperhatikan bahwa sesungguhnya Allah telah menjadikan malam untuk beristirahat dari kesibukan dan kelelahan bekerja pada siang hari, waktu untuk berkumpul dan santai dengan keluarga di rumah masing-masing, dan untuk memulihkan kembali seluruh tenaga dan kekuatan guna melanjutkan tugas pada keesokan harinya. Hari yang terang benderang telah menunggu mereka untuk melanjutkan usaha mencari nafkah bagi diri dan keluarganya. 

Tidakkah mereka memikirkan bahwa kesemuanya diatur dan dikemudikan oleh Allah Yang Mahakuasa, yang dapat menghidupkan, mematikan, dan membangkitkan mereka setelah mati? Sebagaimana siang dan malam banyak mengandung manfaat dan faedah bagi kehidupan manusia, maka demikian pula diutusnya para rasul itu membawa manfaat yang besar sekali bagi kebahagiaan hidup manusia di dunia dan akhirat. Sesungguhnya pada kejadian-kejadian itu terdapat tanda-tanda kekuasaan Allah bagi orang-orang yang beriman.
text.87:
Pada ayat ini, Allah menggambarkan peristiwa kiamat secara khusus, yaitu pada hari peniupan sangkakala oleh malaikat Israfil. Segala yang ada di langit dan di bumi terkejut, kecuali malaikat Jibril, Mikail, Israfil, Izrail, dan orang-orang yang beriman. Tiupan sangkakala itu terjadi dua kali, tiupan pertama yang diberi nama "nafkhah as-sa'q" menyebabkan matinya semua makhluk selain mereka yang dikecualikan. Kemudian dengan tiupan kedua, mereka semuanya akan dibangkitkan dari kubur mereka masing-masing, sebagaimana dalam firman-Nya:

Dan sangkakala pun ditiup, maka matilah semua (makhluk) yang di langit dan di bumi kecuali mereka yang dikehendaki Allah. Kemudian ditiup sekali lagi (sangkakala itu) maka seketika itu mereka bangun (dari kuburnya) menunggu (keputusan Allah). (az-Zumar/39 :68) 

Tiupan yang kedua ini diberi nama "nafkhah al-ba'ts" artinya tiupan kebangkitan, seperti dalam firman-Nya:

Lalu ditiuplah sangkakala, maka seketika itu mereka keluar dari kuburnya (dalam keadaan hidup), menuju kepada Tuhannya. (Yasin/36: 51) 

Peristiwa ini disebutkan pula dalam firman Allah:

(yaitu) pada hari ketika mereka keluar dari kubur dengan cepat seakan-akan mereka pergi dengan segera kepada berhala-berhala (sewaktu di dunia), pandangan mereka tertunduk ke bawah diliputi kehinaan. Itulah hari yang diancamkan kepada mereka. (al-Ma'arij/70: 43-44)
text.88:
Pada ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa gunung-gunung yang sekarang kelihatannya kokoh berdiri di tempatnya, nanti pada hari Kiamat akan dicabut dari bumi kemudian diterbangkan bagaikan bulu di udara dan berjalannya awan. Firman Allah:

Dan gunung-gunung bagaikan bulu (yang beterbangan). (al-Ma'arij/70: 9) 

Ada dua pendapat ulama tafsir mengenai pernyataan ayat ini bahwa gunung-gunung akan diterbangkan di udara seperti jalannya awan, atau dalam ayat lain seperti bulu ditiup oleh angin. Pendapat pertama, yang merupakan pendapat sebagian besar mufasir, mengemukakan bahwa ayat ini berhubungan dengan peristiwa hari Kiamat, seperti dalam firman Allah:

Pada hari (ketika) langit berguncang sekeras-kerasnya, dan gunung berjalan (berpindah-pindah). (ath-thur/52: 9-10 )

Dan firman-Nya:

Dan gunung-gunung pun dijalankan sehingga menjadi fatamorgana. (an-Naba'/78: 20) 

Dalam firman-Nya yang lain:

(Yaitu) pada hari (ketika) bumi di ganti dengan bumi yang lain dan (demikian pula) langit, dan mereka (manusia) berkumpul (di Padang Mahsyar) menghadap Allah Yang Maha Esa, Mahaperkasa. (Ibrahim/14: 48) 

Kejadian-kejadian yang amat dahsyat ini terjadi pada hari Kiamat setelah tiupan sangkakala yang kedua kalinya, dimana semua manusia dibangkitkan dari kuburnya dan mereka menyaksikan segala macam peristiwa yang sangat dahsyat itu dengan sikap yang berbeda-beda.

Pendapat yang kedua mengenai tafsir ayat 88 ini, yakni pendapat ulama ahli falak, menyatakan bahwa ayat ini bukan berhubungan dengan peristiwa hari Kiamat, tetapi dengan fenomena alam di dunia. Ayat ini mengatakan, "Dan engkau akan melihat gunung-gunung, yang engkau kira tetap di tempatnya, padahal ia berjalan (seperti) awan berjalan." Ia dijadikan dalil bahwa bumi berputar seperti planet-planet lain pada garis edar yang telah ditentukan, hanya saja manusia sebagai penghuni bumi tidak merasakannya. 

Alasan ulama falak, bahwa ayat 88 ini berhubungan dengan peristiwa sekarang dan bukan dengan peristiwa hari Kiamat, adalah:

1. Ayat ini tidak dapat dimasukkan dalam kategori ancaman atau menakut-nakuti dengan kedahsyatan hari Kiamat karena di belakangnya di sambung dengan kata-kata: (Itulah) ciptaan Allah yang mencipta dengan sempurna segala sesuatu. Oleh karena itu, ayat ini lebih tepat bila dihubungkan dengan masa sekarang, di mana manusia sebagai penghuni bumi menyangka bahwa bumi ini diam, demikian pula gunung-gunung yang berada di atas permukaannya. Padahal, bumi bersama gunung-gunung itu berjalan atau beredar sebagai jalannya awan.

2. Gunung-gunung itu diterbangkan untuk dihancurkan pada hari Kiamat, dan terjadi bersamaan dengan kehancuran alam semesta, termasuk kematian seluruh manusia. Hanya beberapa malaikat saja yang tetap hidup. Jika pada hari setelah tiupan sangkakala yang pertama tidak ada lagi manusia yang hidup, bagaimana dapat dikatakan bahwa nanti mereka akan melihat gunung-gunung yang disangka diam, padahal ia berjalan seperti jalannya awan. 

3. Orang-orang di Padang Mahsyar yang menyaksikan gunung-gunung berjalan seperti jalannya awan, tentu sadar dan melihat dengan mata kepala sendiri sehingga tidak pantas dikatakan bahwa mereka menyangka gunung-gunung itu diam saja di tempatnya. Berlainan sekali jika dihubungkan dengan masa sekarang, karena memang manusia tidak dapat merasakan bahwa gunung-gunung itu bergerak dan berjalan di angkasa sebagaimana jalannya awan, karena gunung-gunung itu ikut bergerak bersama bumi, dan udara yang ada di sekitarnya. Dengan pengertian yang demikian, maka barulah cocok dengan kata-kata: (Itulah) ciptaan Allah yang mencipta dengan sempurna segala sesuatu. Kata-kata yang indah ini tidak patut dikemukakan pada konteks hari Kiamat yang penuh dengan ancaman dan ketakutan terhadap kehancuran seluruh alam semesta. 

Demikianlah kedua pendapat tentang tafsir ayat 88 ini. Sebagian besar mufasir menerangkan bahwa ayat itu berhubungan dengan peristiwa hari Kiamat. Sebagian lagi yang terdiri dari ulama falak menerangkan bahwa ayat itu berhubungan dengan peristiwa sekarang, dan dijadikan dalil bahwa semua yang ada di atas bumi termasuk gunung-gunung bergerak, berjalan di angkasa sebagaimana berjalannya awan. Perbedaan penafsiran itu tidak mengenai pada tataran arti, namun hanya menyangkut waktu terjadinya. Karena kejadian ini termasuk dalam alam gaib, maka lebih baik perhatian manusia dititikberatkan kepada perbaikan amalnya. Oleh karena itu, pada akhir ayat itu dinyatakan bahwa sesungguhnya Allah Maha Mengetahui apa yang dikerjakan manusia.

Menurut pandangan saintis, bumi merupakan planet terbesar kelima dari sembilan planet yang ada di tata surya. Bentuknya mirip dengan bola bundar, dengan keliling sekitar 12.743 km. Luas permukaan bumi diperkirakan sekitar 510 juta km2. Sekitar 29% permukaan bumi adalah daratan, sedangkan sisanya berupa lautan. 

Bumi terdiri dari beberapa lapisan yang secara garis besar dibagi menjadi 3 bagian. Bagian paling atas disebut kerak bumi dan ketebalannya bervariasi dari 0-100 km di mana ke arah kontinen makin menebal. Di bawahnya terdapat mantel dengan kedalaman sampai 2.900 km. Bagian paling dalam disebut inti bumi dengan kedalaman dari 2.900-6.370 km. Pembagian ini didasarkan pada analisa gelombang gempa dan masing-masing bagian tersebut mempunyai sifat fisis yang berbeda. Inti bumi misalnya mempunyai sifat fisis layaknya benda cair. Pembagian ini pada dasarnya dapat diperinci lebih detail. Manusia berada pada lapisan bumi bagian atas, yakni kerak bumi. 

Sampai paruh abad 20, bidang kebumian ditandai oleh perdebatan tentang continental drift (kontinen yang mengapung). Mereka yang tidak setuju, disebut fixists, sedang yang setuju disebut mobilists. Menurut kubu mobilist, continental mengapung dan bergerak di atas mantel. Kalau kita melihat peta dunia, maka dengan amat mudah kita melihat benua Afrika dan benua Amerika [Selatan] bila diimpitkan, maka garis pantai keduanya relatif berimpit. Jadi, pada dasarnya semua benua yang ada semula berupa satu benua yang satu, yang disebut Pangea, kemudian pecah dan bergerak ke tempat yang sekarang kita lihat. Data ilmiah seperti data kemagnitan purba, kesamaan fosil maupun kesamaan formasi geologi mendukung teori ini. Dan engkau akan melihat gunung-gunung, yang engkau kira tetap di tempatnya, padahal ia berjalan (seperti) awan berjalan. 

Perdebatan ini terus berlangsung dan puncaknya pada tahun enam puluhan. Pada saat itu, terjadilah revolusi pemikiran di bidang ilmu geologi dan pemikiran kaum mobilists mulai diterima secara luas. Penemuan punggungan tengah samudra di Samudra Atlantik dan Samudra Pasifik yang didukung data geologi dan geofisika, khususnya data magnetik, memperlihatkan adanya pemekaran dasar samudra di mana dua lempeng saling bergerak menjauh. Pada lantai samudra ini, magma dengan suhu sangat tinggi yang berasal dari mantel bumi naik ke atas membentuk punggungan tengah samudra 

Dari dua konsep di atas, Apungan Benua dan Pemekaran Samudra, lahir konsep Tektonik Lempeng yang berkembang sangat cepat sejak tahun 1967 dan memiliki implikasi terhadap seluruh aspek geologi termasuk gempa bumi, gunung api, sampai pada perkembangan cekungan hidrokarbon maupun endapan-endapan mineral. Teori ini mengatakan bahwa bumi bagian atas terdiri dari lempengan-lempengan litosfer yang terdiri dari kerak bumi dan mantel bagian atas yang mengapung dan bergerak di atas bagian mantel yang disebut astenosfer.

Lempeng-lempeng litosfer bergerak dan saling berinteraksi satu sama lain. Pada tempat-tempat saling bertemu, pertemuan lempengan ini menimbulkan gempa bumi. Sebagai contoh adalah Indonesia yang merupakan tempat pertemuan tiga lempeng: Eurasia, Pasifik, dan Indo-Australia. Bila dua lempeng bertemu, maka terjadi tekanan (beban) yang terus menerus, dan bila lempengan tidak tahan lagi menahan tekanan (beban), maka lepaslah beban yang telah terkumpul ratusan tahun itu, dan dikeluarkan dalam bentuk gempa bumi, seperti firman Allah:

Apabila bumi diguncangkan dengan guncangan yang dahsyat, dan bumi telah mengeluarkan beban-beban berat (yang dikandung)nya, dan manusia bertanya, "Apa yang terjadi pada bumi ini?" Pada hari itu bumi menyampaikan beritanya. (al-Zalzalah/99: 1-4)

Pada hari itu, bumi menceritakan beritanya. Beban berat yang dikeluarkan dalam bentuk gempa bumi merupakan satu proses geologi yang berjalan bertahun-tahun. Begitu seterusnya, setiap selesai beban dilepaskan, kembali proses pengumpulan beban terjadi. Proses geologi atau berita geologi ini dapat direkam, baik secara alami maupun dengan menggunakan peralatan geofisika ataupun geodesi. Sebagai contoh adalah gempa-gempa yang beberapa puluh atau ratus tahun yang lalu, peristiwa pelepasan beban direkam dengan baik oleh terumbu karang yang berada dekat sumber gempa. Pada masa modern, pelepasan energi ini terekam oleh peralatan seismograf (pencatat gempa) maupun peralatan geodesi yang disebut GPS (Global Position System).
text.89: Ayat ini menjelaskan bahwa orang yang beriman kepada Allah dan melaksanakan amal kebajikan, akan memperoleh balasan yang lebih baik dari amalnya sendiri, dan diberi tempat kediaman yang nyaman dan kekal dalam surga Na'im, mereka aman tenteram dari kejutan yang dahsyat pada hari Kiamat itu.
text.90: Sebaliknya barang siapa yang menyekutukan Allah dan berbuat kejahatan, maka wajah mereka disungkurkan ke dalam neraka seraya dikatakan kepada mereka, "Kamu tidak mendapat balasan, melainkan setimpal dengan kemusyrikan dan kejahatan yang dahulu kamu kerjakan di dunia, sehingga menjadi sebab datangnya kemurkaan Allah."
text.91:
Pada ayat ini, Allah memerintahkan Nabi Muhammad supaya menyampaikan kepada orang-orang musyrik Mekah bahwa beliau hanya disuruh Allah menyembah Tuhan negeri ini (Mekah) yang telah dijadikan sebagai tanah Haram (Tanah Suci), diharamkan adanya pertumpahan darah atau berbuat kezaliman terhadap siapa pun di sana. Penyebutan negeri Mekah secara khusus pada ayat ini karena di sana terdapat Ka'bah, yaitu rumah peribadatan yang pertama kali dibangun di muka bumi ini sebagai tempat manusia menghadap ketika salat di mana pun mereka berada, sesuai dengan firman-Nya:

Sesungguhnya rumah (ibadah) pertama yang dibangun untuk manusia, ialah (Baitullah) yang di Bakah (Mekah) yang diberkahi dan menjadi petunjuk bagi seluruh alam. (ali 'Imran/3: 96) 

Adapun yang wajib disembah hanya Allah, bukan berhala-berhala yang oleh diletakkan kaum musyrikin di sana, sesuai dengan firman Allah:

Maka hendaklah mereka menyembah Tuhan (pemilik) rumah ini (Ka'bah), yang telah memberi makanan kepada mereka untuk menghilangkan lapar dan mengamankan mereka dari rasa ketakutan. (Quraisy/106 : 3-4).

Ini merupakan celaan yang keras kepada orang-orang kafir Mekah yang tidak menyembah Allah yang mempunyai Baitullah, tetapi menyembah berhala-berhala yang mereka tempatkan di sekitarnya. Kepunyaan Allah segala sesuatu, baik di langit maupun bumi, dari segi ciptaan, pemilikan, dan pengurusannya, tidak ada sekutu bagi-Nya. Oleh karena itu, hanya Allah satu-satunya yang berhak disembah dan kepada-Nya Nabi saw diperintahkan supaya berserah diri dengan penuh keikhlasan dan ketauhidan yaitu jalan lurus atau agama Islam, sesuai dengan firman-Nya:

Katakanlah (Muhammad), "Sesungguhnya Tuhanku telah memberiku petunjuk ke jalan yang lurus, agama yang benar, agama Ibrahim yang lurus. Dia (Ibrahim) tidak termasuk orang-orang musyrik."(al-An'am/6: 161)
text.92:
Pada ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa Nabi Muhammad saw diperintahkan supaya membacakan Al-Qur'an kepada manusia, untuk mengungkap makna dan rahasia yang terkandung di dalamnya, dan menyerap dalil-dalil tentang kekuasaan Allah yang dapat dilihat pada alam semesta. Dengan demikian, beliau dapat menyelami hakikat hidup yang sebenarnya dan menerima limpahan karunia Allah kepadanya.

Nabi saw mengulang bacaan ayat itu beberapa puluh kali sampai terbit fajar. Ketika membacanya tampaklah bagi beliau beberapa rahasia yang terkandung di dalamnya, sehingga beliau merasakan faedah membaca ayat Al-Qur'an serta memahami isinya, sesuai dengan firman-Nya:

Demikianlah Kami bacakan kepadamu (Muhammad) sebagian ayat-ayat dan peringatan yang penuh hikmah. (ali 'Imran/3: 58)

Firman Allah yang lain:

Demikianlah, Kami telah mengutus engkau (Muhammad) kepada suatu umat yang sungguh sebelumnya telah berlalu beberapa umat, agar engkau bacakan kepada mereka (Al-Qur'an) yang Kami wahyukan kepadamu. (ar-Ra'd/13: 30)

Barang siapa yang mengikuti ajaran Al-Qur'an, beriman kepada Nabi Muhammad, dan menerima petunjuknya, maka sungguh ia telah menempuh jalan lurus menuju kebahagiaan dunia dan akhirat. Petunjuk itu adalah untuk kebaikan dirinya sendiri. Akan tetapi, barang siapa yang sesat, dan menyeleweng dari jalan lurus yang telah dirintis oleh Nabi, maka kemudaratan akan dirasakan oleh mereka sendiri. Nabi saw tidak akan menderita kerugian apa pun sebab tugas beliau hanya sekadar memberi peringatan sesuai dengan firman Allah:

Maka sesungguhnya tugasmu hanya menyampaikan saja, dan Kamilah yang memperhitungkan (amal mereka). (ar-Ra'd/13: 40)

Dan firman Allah:

Sungguh, engkau hanyalah seorang pemberi peringatan dan Allah pemelihara segala sesuatu. (Hud/11: 12)
text.93:
Pada ayat ini, Allah memerintahkan Nabi Muhammad, yang telah menyampaikan kabar gembira kepada kaum Muslimin yang mengikuti petunjuknya, dan memberi peringatan kepada mereka yang mengingkarinya, untuk mengatakan bahwa segala puji bagi Allah atas segala limpahan rahmat dan karunia-Nya. Di antaranya adalah nikmat kenabian dan kerasulan, yang menyebabkan datangnya nikmat-nikmat yang lain, baik kenikmatan di dunia maupun akhirat.

Allah telah memberi taufik kepada Nabi untuk memikul segala beban dalam melaksanakan seruan agama, dalam rangka ketaatan dan kepatuhan kepada Tuhan Yang Maha Pemurah lagi Maha Pengasih, Yang telah menyediakan keridaan dan pahala yang besar bagi hamba-hamba-Nya yang tulus ikhlas. Allah telah memberikan kepada Nabi berbagai mukjizat, yang menunjukkan kebenaran risalah-Nya dan taufik untuk mengikuti jalan agama yang lurus. Rasul ingin sekali supaya umatnya membuka hati untuk dapat melihat bukti-bukti kebenaran. Akan tetapi, setan dan hawa nafsu telah sedemikian rupa mengelabui mata penglihatan mereka sehingga tidak dapat melihat kenyataan yang sebenarnya.

Jika mereka masih tetap juga membangkang dan keras kepala, maka ingatlah bahwa semua manusia akan mati. Mereka semua pada hari Kiamat akan dibangkitkan dari kuburan masing-masing dan dihadapkan ke hadirat Allah, yang akan memeriksa semua perbuatan yang mereka lakukan di dunia. Di sanalah nanti Allah akan memperlihatkan kepada orang-orang yang membangkang tanda-tanda kebesaran-Nya. Di sana juga nanti Allah akan memperlihatkan kepada mereka azab-Nya yang sangat pedih, sehingga mereka akan mengetahuinya. Di sana jugalah nanti mereka akan mengemukakan penyesalan yang tiada terhingga atas kekafiran mereka terhadap risalah nabi. Penyesalan yang tiada arti dan manfaat lagi karena mereka telah menyia-nyiakan kesempatan dan umur yang telah lewat itu, sedang Tuhan tidak lalai dari apa yang mereka kerjakan.

text.1:
The beginning of this surah explains that the Quran is a revelation from Allah, sent down to the Prophet Muhammad, the last prophet and messenger. The verses of the Quran were revealed through the intermediary of the angel Jibril (Gabriel).

These verses provide explanation and clarification for those who think that the Quran is truly a book revealed by Allah to the Prophet Muhammad. It is not deceptive words or the result of the Prophet Muhammad's fabrication, nor is it the creation of one of Allah's creatures. Humans and jinn cannot possibly create the Quran or match it, even if they both work together for it.

The meaning of the phrase "A Book that explains" refers to the Quran. In this verse, two names of the Quran are gathered, namely "Al-Qur'an" (that which is recited) and "al-Kitab" (that which is written). Two names that have the same meaning and purpose. In another verse, Allah says:

Alif Lam Ra. These are the verses of the Book (the Quran) that makes (things) clear. (al-Hijr/15: 1)

The verses of the Quran provide explanations about the meaning of its verses, because within it are verses that explain each other. The meaning is that there are verses that discuss a problem in detail and explain the meaning of other verses that contain the same problem, but were revealed in a global manner. The verses of the Quran also provide explanations about the purposes of its revelation, such as the laws related to halal and haram, promises and threats, and commands and prohibitions. All of these are made a guide to life in the world as a way to achieve happiness in the afterlife.
text.2:
The Quran serves as guidance and glad tidings for those who believe. Guidance that is Allah's hidayah (guidance), so that people become certain and willing to believe. However, not all people can obtain and enjoy Allah's hidayah, even though the Quran was revealed as guidance and a distinguisher between truth and falsehood for all of humanity, as in Allah's word:

"The month of Ramadan [is that] in which was revealed the Quran, a guidance for the people and clear proofs of guidance and criterion..." (al-Baqarah/2: 185).

Only those who believe and have a willingness within themselves to believe can enjoy the guidance of the Quran. For those who believe, the Quran adds to the existing guidance and hidayah, so that their faith and good deeds increase in carrying out Islamic teachings which also originate from the Quran. Thus, a person's faith can increase and decrease according to their deeds. This is mentioned by Allah in His word:

"...And when a surah is revealed, there are among them who say, "Which of you has this increased faith?" As for those who believed, it has increased them in faith, and they rejoice." (at-Taubah/9: 124).

They rejoice because they receive news about the abundance of Allah's mercy and pleasure. Paradise is also available for them as a dwelling place, full of various kinds of pleasures.
text.3:
This verse explains the characteristics of believers, namely:

1. Establishing prayer (salat), which is performing the obligatory prayers by perfecting their pillars and conditions, in accordance with what Allah has commanded. Prayer is performed with all sincerity of heart, humility, and submission before Allah. Prayer can prevent vile and evil deeds because prayer can eliminate negative character traits. Prayer is an element that forms piety in addition to faith in the unseen. Humility in performing prayer is one of the conditions for becoming a true believer.

The position of prayer in Islam includes:

a. As the pillar of religion, without prayer the religion will collapse.

b. As the first obligation from Allah before other obligatory acts of worship. This obligatory command was received directly by the Prophet Muhammad without the mediation of the angel Gabriel, as mentioned in the story of Isra' Mi'raj.

c. Prayer is the first deed to be reckoned (hisab) on the Day of Judgment. If the prayer is good, then all other deeds will be good as well. Conversely, if the prayer is damaged, then all other deeds will be damaged as well.

2. Paying zakat, which is one of the five pillars of Islam. Paying zakat is obligatory according to the provisions established by Allah and His Messenger. Abu Bakr, as the first caliph after the death of the Prophet Muhammad, fought against those who refused to pay zakat. Whereas zakat is an obligation related to wealth. With zakat, believers cleanse their souls from the traits of stinginess and greed. These two traits can cause fitnah (turmoil) for the owner of the wealth.

Wealth is a sustenance from Allah that must be thanked by paying zakat, as a way to purify it. In that wealth, there is a portion that becomes the right of the poor. For the poor, zakat can cleanse their souls from the traits of envy and jealousy towards the rich. Thus, good relations between the rich and the poor in society will be maintained and the gap between the two can be reduced.

3. Believing in the existence of the Hereafter, meaning believing in the existence of life after death. Everyone will return to face Allah to be reckoned for their good and bad deeds. Both will be rewarded with a fitting reward.

Thus, every human being will be held accountable for what they did during their life in the world. This means that humans were not created by Allah in the world without a purpose or in vain. Allah reminds of this in His word:

"Then did you think that We created you uselessly and that to Us you would not be returned?" (al-Mu'minun/23: 115).
text.4:
In the previous verses, Allah explained some of the attitudes of the believers who received guidance from Allah. This verse explains the behavior and actions of the disbelievers, who do not want to believe in the existence of the afterlife, and the consequences they will feel.

Those who do not believe in the afterlife are those who are not convinced of the existence of the Day of Judgment, are not convinced that all humans will return to Allah through death, are not convinced that they will be resurrected on the Day of Reckoning, and do not believe in the existence of reward as recompense for good deeds and punishment as recompense for bad deeds.

They live in the world without restraining their desires, and are very fond of worldly pleasures, as if living in this world is their only life. They do not recognize halal and haram, and do not think about accountability in the afterlife. They consider all such behavior to be good. In fact, following desires means following the teachings of Satan, who is misguided and leads astray. Thus, they live and wallow in error. This is their recompense for that denial.
text.5:
In this verse, Allah explains that they will receive a terrible punishment in this world and the Hereafter. This is Allah's threat to the disbelievers who do not believe in the Day of Judgment. This verse is also a warning to all mankind.

The punishment in this world can occur through various natural disasters such as floods, earthquakes, wars that bring human and material losses, and so on. This worldly punishment can also be in the form of inner or spiritual torment experienced individually, even though some of them have fulfilled various needs of their worldly life, and some even have more than enough. Nevertheless, their lives are not happy and they are always restless, their souls are empty, and they have no purpose in life because they do not believe in the Day of Judgment.

In the life of the Hereafter, they will suffer great losses and become inhabitants of Hell forever. Each will receive a fitting punishment according to their evil deeds. Because of the severity of the punishment, they then plead with the angels guarding Hell to not be punished, even for just one day. This is mentioned by Allah in His word:

And those in the Fire will say to the keepers of Hell, "Supplicate to your Lord to relieve us from the torment for [only] a day." (al-Mu'min/40: 49).
text.6:
In this verse, Allah commands Prophet Muhammad to announce that the Qur'an was revealed to him through the intermediary of the Angel Gabriel to be understood, memorized, and taught to his people, and to implement the teachings contained within it. The Qur'an is not the creation of the Prophet, as affirmed in His saying:

By the star when it descends, your companion (Muhammad) has not strayed, nor has he erred, nor does he speak from [his own] inclination. It is not but a revelation revealed, taught to him by one mighty in power. (an-Najm/53: 1-5).

It is clear that the Qur'an is from Allah, the All-Wise in all actions towards His creation, the All-Knowing of their conditions and what is good for them. Its news is true and its law is just, as Allah has said:

And the word of your Lord has been fulfilled in truth and in justice. (al-An'am/6: 115).
text.7:
This verse was revealed to the Prophet Muhammad with the command that he convey to his ummah the story of Prophet Musa when he was traveling from Madyan to return to Egypt, accompanied by his family. This journey was undertaken after Musa completed the appointed time, as agreed upon between Musa and his father-in-law. This is mentioned by Allah in His saying:

"Then when Moses had fulfilled the term and was traveling with his family, he perceived from the direction of the mount a fire. He said to his family, "Stay [here]; indeed, I perceive a fire. Perhaps I can bring you from there [some] information or a burning ember so you may warm yourselves." (al-Qasas/28: 29).

The appointed time was the result of an agreement between Musa and his father-in-law when determining the dowry for his marriage, which was to work herding his father-in-law's goats for eight years or to complete it to ten years. Ten years demonstrates his perseverance and sincerity. As for what is meant by "his family" in the verse above, it is his wife, without anyone else.

During the journey on a very dark and cold night, Musa became lost. When he saw a flame from afar, Musa instructed his family to remain in that place, while he would go to the place of the fire. He hoped to obtain directions, so he would not get lost again. According to him, the presence of fire meant that there were people around their location. In addition, Prophet Musa hoped to bring his family fire, ignited from the source of the fire he saw. With that flame, he and his family could certainly stay warm and ward off the gripping cold.
text.8:
When Moses approached the fire, what he thought was fire turned out to be unlike any fire he had ever seen. It was a light emanating from a type of green-colored, hair-like plant that wrapped around and hung from a tree branch. The light radiating from the tree shone brightly, while the branch remained green and fresh, neither burning nor withering.

Moses found no one in that place, so he was amazed and astonished by the situation. He intended to take some of the flame from the branch that leaned towards him. As he tried to ignite the flame, Moses felt afraid. In that state, he was suddenly called by a voice coming from the direction of the tree. The voice declared that those near the fire were blessed, namely Moses and the angels. This statement was a greeting and honor from Allah to Prophet Moses, just as the angels greeted Prophet Abraham in His saying:

"The mercy of Allah and His blessings be upon you, O people of the house." (Hud/11: 73)

'Abdullah bin 'Abbas stated that what is meant by "blessed" here is what Allah has sanctified. According to him, what Prophet Moses saw as fire was not fire, but a light blazing like fire. That light was the light of the Lord of the Worlds. This is strengthened by the hadith narrated by Abu 'Ubaidah from Abu Musa al-Asy'ari that the Prophet Muhammad said:

"Indeed, Allah does not sleep, and it is not befitting for Allah to sleep. He lowers and raises the scales, the deeds of the night are raised before Him before the day, and the deeds of the day before the night, and His veil is light. If He were to remove His veil, surely the glory of His face would burn everything that His sight reaches among His creation." (Narrated by Muslim)

That event occurred when Moses reached the blessed place, which is the sacred valley called the Valley of Tuwa, as mentioned in His saying:

"...He was called from the right side of the valley in a blessed spot, from the tree..." (al-Qasas/28: 30).

And the saying of Allah which reads:

"When his Lord called him in the sacred valley of Tuwa." (an-Naziat/79: 16).

The call of Allah that Moses heard in the sacred valley of Tuwa was a revelation appointing Prophet Moses as a messenger. He was sent by Allah to convey the message to Pharaoh in Egypt, equipped with various miracles.

Moses faced Allah directly when receiving the revelation, but Moses could not see Him, because he was blocked by a veil in the form of light. This kind of revelation is one of the ways Allah conveys revelation to His prophets. Allah mentions this in His saying:

"And it was not for any human being that Allah should speak to him except by revelation or from behind a veil or by sending a messenger who reveals, by His permission, what He wills..." (asy-Syura/42: 51).

Glory be to Allah, the Lord of all the worlds, who does what He wills. There is no creature like Him. He is the Most Great and Most High above all His creation. What Moses heard was the voice of Allah's word. This is stated by Allah in the ninth verse that the one who called and summoned him was Allah, not the voice of a creature. Allah is All-Powerful over all things, All-Wise in His words and deeds.

"When his Lord called him in the sacred valley of Tuwa." (an-Naziat/79: 16).

The call of Allah that Moses heard in the sacred valley of Tuwa was a revelation appointing Prophet Moses as a messenger. He was sent by Allah to deliver the message to Pharaoh in Egypt, equipped with various miracles.

Moses faced Allah directly when receiving the revelation, but Moses could not see Him, because he was obstructed by a veil in the form of light. This type of revelation is one of the ways Allah conveys revelation to His prophets. Allah mentions this in His saying:

"And it was not for any human being that Allah should speak to him except by revelation or from behind a veil or by sending a messenger who reveals, by His permission, what He wills..." (asy-Syura/42: 51).

Glory be to Allah, the Lord of all the worlds, who does what He wills. There is no creature like Him. He is the Most Great and Most High above all His creation. What Moses heard was the voice of Allah's word. This is stated by Allah in the ninth verse that the one who called and summoned him was Allah, not the voice of a creature. Allah is All-Powerful over all things, All-Wise in His words and deeds.
text.10:
This verse is a continuation of the direct conversation between Allah and Musa in the sacred valley of Thuwa. After Musa was appointed as a prophet and messenger, Allah commanded Musa to throw the staff he held in his right hand.

When the staff was thrown, Musa saw it moving like a *jann*, which is a type of snake that moves very swiftly. It never occurred to Musa that his staff would turn into a snake, even though Musa could benefit from the staff in his daily life as a shepherd. This is stated by Allah in His words:

He (Musa) said, "It is my staff; I lean upon it, and I beat down (leaves) for my sheep, and for me therein are other uses." (Taha/20:18).

When Musa saw his staff become a snake, he turned and ran away without looking back, because he was very frightened. At that moment, Allah said to Musa not to be afraid, because indeed, those who are appointed as messengers should not be afraid in His presence. This call from Allah was preceded by an order to come before Him and a guarantee of safety. So Allah affirmed with His words:

..."O Musa, approach and fear not. Indeed, you are of the secure." (Al-Qasas/28:31).

In addition, Allah commanded Musa to hold the snake so that it would become a staff again. This was the first miracle for Musa. Allah's word:

He (Allah) said, "Seize it and fear not; We will return it to its former condition." (Taha/20:21).

As for those who fear Allah, they are those who commit *zalim*, who place things out of place. *Zalim* can be against oneself, others, or other creatures of Allah.

A person who sincerely repents to Allah will not commit *zalim* again, then follow it with good deeds, and need not fear facing Allah. This is good news for them and also for all of humanity, as was the behavior of Pharaoh's magicians who believed in Musa as a messenger of Allah. Whoever commits sin, then stops those actions and repents, then Allah will accept his repentance. This is affirmed by Allah in His words:

And indeed, I am the Perpetual Forgiver of whoever repents and believes and does righteousness and then continues in guidance. (Taha/20:82).

And His word again:

And whoever does a wrong or wrongs himself but then seeks forgiveness of Allah will find Allah Forgiving and Merciful. (An-Nisa'/4:110).

text.12:
In this verse, Allah demonstrates another of His powers, after showing His power to transform an inanimate object in Moses' hand into a living creature in the form of a snake. Then Moses was commanded to put his hand into his armpit, through the opening of his garment's neckline. When he took it out, the hand emitted a brilliant white light. This was Moses' second miracle.

These two kinds of Moses' miracles are part of the nine miracles that Allah gave him. These miracles served as proof to Pharaoh and his people that Moses was Allah's messenger to invite them to the path that is right and pleasing to Him. The number of Moses' nine miracles is affirmed by Allah in His word:

"And We had certainly given Moses nine evident signs." (al-Isra'/17: 101).

Moses was sent by Allah with various extraordinary events to confront Pharaoh and his wicked people, who exceeded the limits of human nature. Pharaoh even claimed himself to be God and this claim was justified by his people. This is mentioned by Allah in His word:

"(He) said, "I am your most exalted lord." (an-Nazi'at/79: 24).
text.13: When Moses confronted him, Pharaoh claimed that he was a god. Pharaoh asked Moses for proof that he was truly a messenger of Allah. Moses, as a messenger of Allah, provided proof by throwing his staff, which then became a snake that moved swiftly, and then inserting his hand into his armpit through the opening of his garment's neckline, and when he took it out, his hand became white, shining brilliantly for those who saw it. This verse explains that the two proofs above were very clear, serving as real witnesses that Moses was truly a messenger of Allah. However, they denied these proofs and said that they were merely magic.
text.14:
They denied these proofs with their words, while in their hearts, they acknowledged that Moses was a messenger of Allah. They disbelieved because their hearts were filled with injustice (zalim) and arrogance, as a result of which they refused to follow the truth. Their arrogant, haughty, and conceited attitude is affirmed by Allah in His word:

...But they were arrogant people. (al-Mu'minun/23: 46).

This is a warning for the Prophet Muhammad and his ummah. They are called upon to pay attention to the consequences experienced by Pharaoh and his people, which was destruction by drowning in the sea, as Allah says:

So We inflicted retribution on them and drowned them in the sea, because they denied Our signs and were heedless of them. (al-A'raf/7: 136).

The verse above is also a warning for those who deny the Prophet Muhammad. They will receive the same consequences as those in the past who denied the teachings of Allah.
text.15:
This verse explains that Allah has bestowed upon Prophet Daud and Prophet Sulaiman (son of Prophet Daud) knowledge, both related to the knowledge of God and His laws, as well as related to general knowledge, such as the ability and talent to lead and manage their people. These two prophets not only possessed knowledge, but also practiced it well. Thus, the knowledge possessed by each prophet was not only beneficial to himself, but also to society and his people in this world and in the hereafter.

Because they received immeasurable blessings from Allah, they expressed gratitude for these blessings by saying:

"All praise is due to Allah, who has favored us above many of His believing servants."

The attitude of gratitude shown by Prophet Daud and Prophet Sulaiman in receiving Allah's blessings is a commendable attitude. Therefore, the scholars encourage Muslims to emulate this attitude. Being grateful for blessings means that the servant who receives the blessing truly feels that what he receives is an expression of Allah's love for him and feels that he truly needs that blessing from Allah. Without that blessing, he would not live and experience happiness. Allah says:

"And [remember] when your Lord proclaimed, 'If you are grateful, I will surely increase you [in favor]; but if you deny, indeed, My punishment is severe.'" (Ibrahim/14: 7).

Allah elevated Prophet Daud as a head of state and a messenger of Allah. As a head of state, Allah bestowed upon Prophet Daud all kinds of knowledge that were needed. Among the virtues and knowledge bestowed upon him were:

1. Allah subjected the mountains and birds to Daud. The mountains and birds glorified Allah with Daud morning and evening. Allah says:

"Indeed, We subjected the mountains [to exalt Us] with him, exalting [Allah] in the [late] afternoon and [early] morning, and the birds, assembled. All were, for Him, constantly returning." (Sad/38: 18-19).

2. Allah bestowed upon Daud the knowledge to soften iron, so that he could make armor and other necessities, to strengthen his government and his prophethood. Allah says:

"...and We softened iron for him." (Saba'/34: 10).

3. Allah strengthened Daud's kingdom and bestowed upon him wisdom and sagacity, so that he could easily resolve disputes and cases brought before him. Allah says:

"And We strengthened his kingdom and gave him wisdom and sound judgment in speech." (Sad/38: 20).

According to al-Baidhawi, what is meant by Allah's statement, "And We strengthened his kingdom" is, "We (Allah) strengthened him with immunity, victory in war, and many soldiers."

4. Allah revealed the book of Zabur to him, so that he was one of the four messengers to whom books were revealed. Allah says:

"...And We have already given some prophets preference over others, and to David We gave the book [of Psalms]." (al-Isra'/17: 55).

5. Allah gave him the ability to understand the speech of birds, as explained in the following verse.
text.16:
This verse explains that Solomon, son of David, succeeded his father as king and messenger of Allah. According to Ibn 'Athiyyah, David was a king and messenger of Allah sent to the Children of Israel. Solomon held this position after his father passed away. Because Solomon received both positions after his father's death, it is stated in this verse: "And Solomon inherited David."

According to al-Kalbi, Prophet David had 19 sons. Among them all, only Solomon inherited knowledge and the ability to control the government from his father. Therefore, he succeeded his father as head of state. Then Allah also appointed Solomon as a messenger.

According to the Encyclopedia Americana, Prophet David was appointed king in 1002 BC, when he was 37 years old (he was born in 1039 BC). David died in 962 BC, and reigned for 40 years, namely 7 years in Hebron and 33 years in Jerusalem.

Before his death, David appointed his son Solomon as king after him. He died after giving invaluable advice and messages to Solomon. Among the advice and messages was to worship Allah, maintain all laws, regulations, sharia, and His words, in accordance with what is stated in the Torah of Moses, and to establish a Haikal as a place of worship to Him. After Prophet David died, Solomon began to hold the reins of government in 961 BC. As a king and prophet, all of Prophet David's advice and messages were carried out well, so that the kingdom became stable and firm in his hands, until he died. (See "David", Encyclopaedia Americana, Volume 8, p. 526).

In addition to inheriting the kingdom, knowledge, prophethood, and the Zabur from his father, Solomon was also bestowed by Allah with several other virtues. Therefore, he was grateful to Allah by saying, "O mankind, Allah has bestowed upon us understanding and knowledge of the language of birds, and has given us everything necessary. Indeed, all of this is truly a manifest bounty."

Prophet Solomon, with the strength and ability that Allah had given him, could understand the sounds of other animals, besides the sounds of birds. In this verse, it is specifically mentioned that Solomon understood the language of birds because birds were Prophet Solomon's special army that also had special privileges, as had been done by the hoopoe bird.

As is known, the sounds of animals are a sign language that applies among them. These sounds are heard in various forms and tones, such as the sound in a cheerful state being different from the sound of a bird in a state of fear. The sound of a female goat that has lost its young is different from the sound of being chased or pounced on by wild animals. Prophet Solomon knew the meaning of these animal sounds with the strength of feeling and knowledge that Allah had bestowed upon him. According to al-Baidhawi, when he heard the sounds of birds, Prophet Solomon knew the meaning and intent of those sounds with the strength of his feelings.

In this verse, it is also explained that Allah has bestowed upon Solomon all kinds of abilities and everything he needed to control the government of his country. Thus, the reign of Prophet Solomon was a period of glory for the Children of Israel.

Some commentators interpret the verse "wa utina min kulli syai'in" (and given everything necessary), meaning that Allah has bestowed upon Solomon wisdom, multiplied wealth, great and vast power as a king, and subjugated jinn, humans, birds, and other animals.

Because of the blessings that had been bestowed, Prophet Solomon was grateful to Allah by stating that all the blessings that had been bestowed upon him, whether in the form of knowledge, gifts, virtues, and so on, were a privilege that Allah had given him. With these various gifts, Allah had favored him over other human beings.
text.17: This verse explains that Solomon was able to form an army consisting of various types of creatures, such as jinn, humans, birds, and other animals. This army could be deployed at any time to fight those who refused to heed his call. All of these soldiers stood in neat rows, united, and gathered under his leadership.
text.18:
This verse explains that at one time, Solomon was traveling with his army through an area, which according to Qatadah, was a region in the valley of Sham. In this situation, Solomon suddenly heard the voice of an ant king ordering his people to immediately enter their respective burrows, so as not to be trampled by Solomon and his army. Solomon and his army could have trampled them without realizing it, because ants are very small creatures, so Solomon and his army did not see them.

This verse shows the existence of communication between ants and social life under the leadership of their king. Research reveals that to carry out this highly organized social life, ants have sophisticated communication capabilities. In the head of the ant there is a set of antennae that can recognize chemical and visual signals. Its brain consists of about half a million nerve nodes, has well-functioning eyes, and antennae that function as a nose to smell or fingertips to feel. Protrusions located under its mouth function as taste buds. While the hairs on its body react to touch.

Although ants have many organs for communication, the main communication they carry out is chemical communication. They communicate using pheromones, a chemical compound like a hormone that emits an odor and is produced by one of the glands in the ant's body. Ants communicate using this hormone. When an ant releases pheromones, other ants will receive it by smelling or touching it, and react to it.
text.19:
Hearing the ant king's statement that Solomon and his army did not intend to destroy them and do evil, made Solomon smile. The ant king also said that if any of the ants were trampled by Solomon and his army, it was not done intentionally, but because Solomon and his army did not see them, because their bodies were very small.

Because of the grace and favor that Allah had given to Solomon in the form of the ability to understand the ant king's conversation, and the ant king's good opinion of Solomon and his army, Solomon prayed to Allah, "O my Lord, the Giver of Mercy, make me among those who continuously give thanks for Your blessings that You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents. Make me one of Your servants who always performs righteous deeds that You are pleased with, and make me a person who desires to do those righteous deeds. When I die, admit me into Paradise together with the righteous people whom You admit into it by Your mercy."

From the prayer of Prophet Solomon, it is understood that what Solomon asked of Allah was eternal happiness in the Hereafter. Even though Allah had bestowed upon him various kinds of worldly pleasures and power, he did not forget himself because of it. He was certain that worldly pleasures are temporary in nature and not eternal.

The attitude of Prophet Solomon when receiving Allah's blessings is an attitude that should be emulated and made an example by every Muslim. Pray and be grateful to Allah every time you receive His blessings, and do not deny His blessings.
text.20:
This verse explains that one day Prophet Sulaiman (Solomon) inspected the ranks of his army, including the hud-hud bird, but he did not see it. With an angry and surprised tone, he said, "Why do I not see the hud-hud bird! Is it that I do not see it, or has the hud-hud bird itself gone without asking permission from me beforehand?"

This action was something that had never happened before. From this verse, the following points are understood:

1. Prophet Sulaiman had an army, and among them was a type of bird called the hud-hud bird. The hud-hud bird is a type of insect-eating bird, a kind of woodpecker. It has a long beak, a crest on its head, a long tail, and beautiful multi-colored feathers. It lives by making nests or holes in dead and decaying trees.

2. Prophet Sulaiman always inspected his army. Therefore, he knew which of his soldiers were present and absent during the inspection.

3. Every soldier, when traveling or doing something, should obtain permission from him beforehand. If anyone violates this provision, they will be punished by Sulaiman.

4. Sulaiman's soldiers obediently followed all his commands and no one ever disobeyed him. Therefore, Sulaiman was surprised and astonished at the hud-hud bird's departure without permission. Such an event had never happened before. He then threatened the hud-hud bird with severe punishment if it returned without presenting acceptable reasons.
text.21:
This verse explains Prophet Solomon's threat to the hoopoe bird who left without permission. He said, "If the hoopoe bird returns later, without presenting a strong reason for its departure without asking permission, then I will punish it by plucking its feathers, so that it can no longer fly, or I will slaughter it. One of these two punishments will I carry out against it, so that it can be a lesson for others who act like the hoopoe bird."

From this verse, it is understood that if the hoopoe bird can present reasons for its departure without permission and those reasons can be believed to be true, then Solomon will not carry out the punishment that he had threatened.
text.22:
Not long after the threat of punishment for the hoopoe bird was issued, the bird arrived. Solomon then asked about the reasons for the hoopoe bird's departure without permission.

The hoopoe bird explained the reason for its departure, saying that it had gone and flown across a distant region and had arrived at a country called Saba'. It knew about the affairs of that country, which Solomon himself did not yet know. The news it brought was important and could be believed to be true.

The hoopoe bird had conveyed this important news to Prophet Solomon in such a way, with sweet and respectful words, pleasing to the ear, accompanied by strong reasons. Thus, Solomon's anger towards the hoopoe bird gradually subsided, eventually disappearing completely. In fact, with that explanation, Prophet Solomon had gained something valuable, so the punishment he had threatened was not carried out.

The hoopoe bird's ability to travel so far and deliver important news to Prophet Solomon is a manifestation of Allah's power and the inspiration He instilled in the hoopoe bird's instincts. It was able to go and fly across the region located between Palestine and Yemen today, a considerable distance, traversing a very hot desert area. It knew and understood the state of Saba', which also needed to be known by Prophet Solomon, who served as a head of state and also a messenger of Allah. It was also able to convey the news and provide a good understanding, so that Prophet Solomon immediately responded to the news brought by the hoopoe bird.

Prophet Solomon was a prophet and messenger. He was also a wise king, who had great power and abundant wealth. He had a lot of knowledge in addition to other knowledge that Allah may have only given to him. While the hoopoe bird was just a bird that had no meaning at all, when compared to what Prophet Solomon possessed. Even so, the hoopoe bird possessed knowledge that Prophet Solomon did not yet know. This knowledge was very much needed by Prophet Solomon in carrying out his duties as king, especially in carrying out his duties as a prophet and messenger of Allah. In dealing with the hoopoe bird as a source and bearer of important news, Prophet Solomon was able to act naturally, as a servant of Allah.

The story of Prophet Solomon and the hoopoe bird should be an example and lesson for mankind, especially for those who have claimed to believe in Allah. One should not feel arrogant and conceited because of the knowledge, power, and wealth that Allah has given him. All that is given, no matter how much one thinks it is, is only a very small amount compared to the knowledge, power, and wealth of Allah. Therefore, never underestimate, trivialize, or despise something or someone. Perhaps Allah has given to someone who is considered despised and lowly, what others do not have, which may be needed for a certain purpose, as He has bestowed upon the hoopoe bird. Allah is Most Gracious, Most Merciful, and honors mankind. Therefore, let mankind live in love, helping each other, and respecting each other. Imitate Prophet Solomon's attitude towards the hoopoe bird, who always loved and respected it, even though it was just a bird.
text.23:
This verse explains that the hoopoe bird conveyed to Prophet Sulaiman various knowledge and experiences it had gained during its journey to the land of Saba'. A large and wealthy land ruled by a beautiful queen who possessed a grand and magnificent throne.

In this verse, it is understood that there are three things regarding the land of Saba' that the hoopoe bird conveyed to Prophet Sulaiman:

1.  The land of Saba' was ruled by a beautiful queen who governed her land well and wisely.

2.  The queen ruled firmly and wisely because she was equipped with everything needed in governance, such as wealth and riches, a strong army, and so on.

3.  The queen possessed a beautiful and large throne, which demonstrated the greatness and influence of her power, both over her people and over the surrounding lands.

Historically, Saba' was the capital of the kingdom of Saba' or Sabaiyah. This kingdom of Saba' or Sabaiyah was founded by Saba' bin Yasyjub bin Ya'rub bin Qahthan, who became the ancestor of the people of Yemen around 955 BC in Yemen. The name of the city of Saba' was taken from the name Saba' bin Yasyjub, as was the name of the kingdom of Saba' or Sabaiyah.

The people of Saba' are famous in history as people who were active in the field of commerce. Sea and land trade routes met in the land of Yemen. Trade goods were brought from the Far East (Indonesia, Malaysia, India, and China) to Europe via Persia, Yemen, Syria, and Egypt. Thus, the Yemen region was a trade link connecting the eastern region with the western region. The people of Saba' played a major role in facilitating this trade. The land of Yemen had a naval fleet and land caravans to transport this trade, while the city of Ma'rib at that time was an international city. The goods traded were agricultural products and goods from the Far East, plus the abundant agricultural products of the land of Yemen, because the Yemen region was indeed a very prosperous region. When returning from Europe, Egypt, and Syria, the merchants brought textiles to the East.

The prosperity of the land of Yemen was due to the water dams built by the kings of Sabaiyah. Among them was a giant dam in the city of Ma'rib known as the Ma'rib Dam. With the existence of the Ma'rib Dam, the people of Saba' were able to carry out regular irrigation, so that the Yemen region became fertile and produced abundant yields. The Qur'an itself mentions that the fertility of the land of Yemen is one of the signs of Allah's power.

As for the woman or queen who ruled the people of Saba' mentioned in the verse, according to Arab culture, she was called Balqis. Her reign coincided with the reign of Prophet Sulaiman. She was the daughter of Syurahil who also came from the descendants of Ya'rub bin Qahthan. Even though Balqis was a woman, she was able to bring the people of Saba' to prosperity and peace. She was a person who was loved by her people. In history, she is known as Malikatus Saba' (Queen of Sheba, The Queen of Sheba).

The glory of the kingdom of Saba' lasted quite a long time. Then they turned away from the call of God and denied the messengers and did not give thanks for His blessings, even drowning in all kinds of pleasures and luxuries of life. Therefore, God destroyed them with a great flood due to the collapse of the Saddu (Dam) of Ma'rib, which had previously been the source of their land's prosperity. With the collapse of the Ma'rib Dam and the occurrence of a great flood, the city of Ma'rib was destroyed, and the kingdom of Sabaiyah collapsed. (See Surah Saba'/34: 15-17).
text.24:
The hoopoe bird explained to Prophet Solomon about the religion adhered to by the people of Saba'. In conveying the news, it was apparent that the hoopoe bird had compared the religion and actions of the people of Saba' with the beliefs and religion it believed to be the true religion.

The hoopoe said that it found the queen and her people worshipping the sun as a god, and performing acts of disobedience that contradicted the true religion. They did so because Satan had succeeded in deceiving them. Satan had made their thoughts and views of evil deeds forbidden by Allah appear good and beautiful. They no longer followed the teachings and religion brought by the previous messengers. They no longer prostrated to Allah, but to the sun. Therefore, they did not receive guidance.
text.25: Satan has been able to turn them away from belief in the power and oneness of Allah, so that they do not worship Him. They no longer believe that Allah knows all that is hidden in the heavens and on earth. He is Allah who created everything, such as plants and metal objects hidden in the earth and in the sea.
text.26:
Furthermore, the hoopoe stated that in reality, it is Allah who deserves to be worshipped. He is the One who possesses the Great 'Arsh, possesses absolute power, and nothing can overcome Him.

Prophet Solomon was astonished and amazed to hear the hoopoe's explanation and response. How could the bird, in such a short time, know the state of the land of Saba', its governance, its wealth and influence, and also know the religion they adhered to? The hoopoe also knew and believed in the power and oneness of Allah, acknowledging that the only God worthy of worship is Allah alone, and no other. It also knew that worshipping the sun is a false belief, and also knew the forms of good and bad deeds according to religion. From this verse, it is understood that based on its knowledge and experience in the land of Saba', it was as if the hoopoe was encouraging Prophet Solomon to immediately call Queen Balqis and her people to believe in Allah and follow the call of Prophet Solomon.
text.27: Hearing the clear and convincing explanation from the hoopoe bird, Prophet Solomon postponed the punishment he had threatened the bird with. Prophet Solomon then said, "O hoopoe bird, we have heard all your explanation and paid attention to it. Nevertheless, we will still test you, whether the explanation you have given is true or a lie?"
text.28:
To test the truthfulness of the hoopoe bird, Prophet Solomon ordered it to deliver a letter to Queen Bilqis. It was also ordered to observe how Queen Bilqis reacted and behaved upon reading the letter it carried.

The hoopoe then carried Prophet Solomon's letter. After it threw the letter to Queen Bilqis, it hid and observed Queen Bilqis's reaction to the contents of the letter, according to Solomon's instructions.
text.29:
After Queen Balqis read the letter from Prophet Sulaiman, which was delivered by the hud-hud bird, she gathered the leaders of her people and held a meeting. In that meeting, Queen Balqis conveyed the contents of the letter and sought advice from those present, "O leaders of my people, I have received a noble and significant letter sent by someone noble as well."

This verse explains that Queen Balqis discussed and consulted on the contents of Sulaiman's letter with the leaders of her people. Even though the consultation was carried out by Queen Balqis and the leaders of her people who had not yet believed, Queen Balqis's action is mentioned by Allah in His word. This shows that the principle of consultation (musyawarah) is a principle taught by Allah to humans in facing the problems they experience in their lives. Therefore, whoever does it, that action is praised by Allah.

In this verse, Sulaiman's letter sent to Queen Balqis is called *kitabun karim* (a noble letter). This shows that Prophet Sulaiman's letter was noble and valuable because:

1. The letter was written in good language and used a stamp as a sign of an official letter.

2. The letter came from Sulaiman, as a king and a prophet.

3. The letter began with *Bismillahir Rahmanir Rahim*.

According to a narration, Sulaiman's letter was the first letter to begin with the basmalah. Making letters in the way that Prophet Sulaiman did is a good way for every Muslim to emulate when making letters.

There are several things that happened thanks to the special nature of Sulaiman's letter, including:

1. The letter was delivered by the hud-hud bird in a short time to the Queen of Sheba (Saba').

2. The ability of the hud-hud bird to receive messages and capture conversations in the Queen of Sheba's deliberations with her dignitaries.

3. The letter could also be understood and comprehended by the people of Sheba.

4. The envoys of the leaders of the people of Sheba were able to express their opinions freely. There was nothing to prevent them from expressing their respective opinions. Thus, the result of the deliberations was a result that was in accordance with the thoughts and opinions of the people of Sheba.
text.30:
After Queen Balqis read the letter from Prophet Sulaiman, which was delivered by the hud-hud bird, she gathered the leaders of her people and held a meeting. In that meeting, Queen Balqis conveyed the contents of the letter and sought advice from those present, "O leaders of my people, I have received a noble and significant letter sent by someone noble as well."

In this verse, it is explained that Queen Balqis discussed and deliberated the contents of Sulaiman's letter with the leaders of her people. Even though the consultation was conducted by Queen Balqis and the leaders of her people who had not yet believed, Queen Balqis's action is mentioned by Allah in His word. This shows that the principle of consultation (musyawarah) is a principle taught by Allah to humans in facing the problems they experience in their lives. Therefore, whoever does it, that action is an action praised by Allah.
